result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deonte Laroy Cheeks

records.addlTxt: /From Attorney Jon Josephsen dated 10/19/2022 regarding motion to increase bail, filed
State's Notice of Motion and Motion to Increase Bail, filed.

Defendant Deonte Laroy Cheeks appeared by video. Attorney Thomas Flanagan appears in person.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge VanGrunsven Branch 09.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 09.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Deonte Cheeks in court in person.  Attorney Thomas Flanagan appeared by video for Deonte Laroy Cheeks.  Prosecuting Attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Flanagan is newly retained and needs time to meet with his client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Appearance.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Deonte Laroy Cheeks in court with Attorney Bryan Joseph Cecil.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON
Case set for status. Mr Cheeks plans to retain private counsel. Parties are advised the Attorney Cecil will remain as counsel in the event private is not retained.   Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Deonte Laroy Cheeks in court, appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Status in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances and no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT for Level 2 supervision. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT immediately upon leaving court.  
IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Deonte Laroy Cheeks in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Deonte Laroy Cheeks in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/02/2022@130p
